channel.description: CIS 527 Lab 1 - Ubuntu File Permissions Linux File Permissions Classes User - owner of the file Group - group assigned to file Others - other users Permissions Read - read file contents Write - change/delete file Execute - run program or script & list folder contents File List Image Credit: Digital Ocean File Modes Image Credit: Digital Ocean Octal Permissions Image Credit: Just Enough Linux Common Octal Values Image Credit: Linode Modifying Permissions File Browser (Nautilus) Edit as Administrator (Using "nautilus-admin") Terminal Terminal Commands chmod - Change Permissions (Mode) chmod [class][op][mode] <path> chmod [ugoa][+-=][rwx] <path> chmod [octal_mode] <path> chown - Change Owner chown [user]:[group] <path> chgrp - Change Group chgrp [group] <path> Must Own File Next Step!
